reviews.title: Don’t look out for their customers
text: Staff failed to tell me the parking out front is a tow zone after 5pm (there are no signs). So my spa experience was ok but leaving the spa to my car being gone was hell. The receptionist says it happens all the time but no signs or warnings from the spa. $500 extra in car ticket and fees. Will certainly not be going back !

reviews.title: Harassed and Mould Mould Mould
text: Mould mould mould - and smells coming from the tubs and shower areas.

This spa harassed me and ignored my disability. This was not relaxing and they still have not done anything about it. The staff were beyond rude. This place does not support women with disabilities. I am still shocked by my experience. .

I wear a medical decider bag requires a phone connection. Their staff were not knowledgeable and kicked us out in front of others. The place was such low class and not spa level cleanliness or service.
They have not addressed the damage that this experience caused as I worry they will repeat this with others facing disabilities or unique health needs.
Don’t go!

reviews.title: Absolutely ZERO customer service
text: I was gifted a spa package and unfortunately I was not able to attend ok the day it was booked for.
I tried to call the spa (several times) nobody ever answers the phone there.
I left voice-mail and phoned the next day to arrange for a new date for my package.

A few hours later someone phoned me back to say I'd  be charged a 50% fee to change the date (50% of the price of my package). I was never told about cancelation fees, I was never sent a confirmation email. The voice mail they left me said "you can make any changes as needed" with no mention of any additional fees. I was told a manager would call me back to sort out the issue. It's been 3 days and many many ignored voice mails later and I'm still waiting.
I have yet to resolve the issue with Body Blitz as they will not return my phone calls or emails. They did charge the credit card right away though.
WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I have ever received from any business.

reviews.title: Unpleasant and Unprofessional
text: Arrived for a massage appointment and they said I wasn't booked despite having scheduled the appointment the day before.  The manager denied that staff could have made an error and refused entry as a good will gesture despite lack of customers. The encounter was unpleasant, unprofessional and friends have confirmed similar experiences.  I will not be returning.

reviews.title: Great first time!
text: I visited the West location. The staff were friendly, the pool was really nice (albeit a bit noisy but it was a Sat afternoon with a lot of people so to be expected). The sauna was great, the steam room was a bit too much for me (I found it hard to breathe, but that might just be me- I've never been in one and probably won't again). My appointment was great and the lady who worked on me was lovely (I wish I remembered her name!). Also had a juice by the pool, it was delicious. Thinking I'll take my mom here for a massage.

reviews.title: Totally disappointed
text: If you are still crazy about Covid - this place is definitely for you. They still ask for proof of vaccination (even though it was cancelled in the province on March 1) and make you wear a mask EVERYWHERE (even in a pool) (except for steam room - wow). Mask becomes wet, makes it hard to breather but no one cares. Funny enough you must wear a mask but you don't have to wear the top of your swim suit. Feels like you are in prison as employees watch very thoroughly and if the mask goes down even a bit, they make sure to tell you that. No way you can relax and enjoy experience. Totally disappointed.

reviews.title: Very very BAD
text: Very very very bad. So controlled and not relaxing at all. To be forced to swim with masks in the pool and mask in sauna is absolute nonsense!

reviews.title: Pools are good. Strong chlorine.
text: My biggest issue with the space (with both locations) is that there is far too much chlorine used in the pools. Every time I leave I can taste it and smell it for hours. Other than that, it's great to have as a nearby spa option. If you can go when there is less traffic, it's a nice few hours to unwind and relax. I don't go as often as I would like to purely because of the chlorine.

reviews.title: Massage & use of therapy pools
text: Massage was excellent. Very intuitive to my needs & restrictions. I found the therapy pools, sauna & mist room a bit too crowded for me but that may have been time of day (noon)

reviews.title: Awful experience
text: I had a bad allergic reaction to the ‘face and scalp ‘ treatment. The customer service I received afterwards was awful. Horrible experience.

reviews.title: Great spa
text: My high school friends wanted a spa day.  We choice body blitz the king street location. It was clean with a nice sauna and Epson salt hot tub . It was an amazing experience and to top it off Sarah gave me the best and massage of my life especially focusing on the exact location of my needs.  They also supplied us with robes and flip flops creams body wash etc.  Thanks body blitz for a well deserved stress releaving experience.

reviews.title: Very noisy, outdated and overpriced - Won''t comeback!
text: I'm very disappointed with this spa. It was very noisy; the pool area is oudated, no extra towels no privacy. They charge for regular drinks, and you can't take pictures inside. I guess because they want to avoid people showing what exactly looks like on the inside. Usually, when I go to high-end spas,  refreshments are for free, and very often they offer a glass of champagne at the end. The body scrub was not worth the price, and I didn't notice any difference in my skin and was not relaxing.

reviews.title: Relaxing and tranquil!
text: My sister and I have a girls night out and decided to check out Body Blitz as heard good reviews from friends. Well we certainly were not disappointed! If you come on Tuesday it is $10 cheaper which is a good price for about 2 hours in the baths. Circuit of baths/sauna/steam room is well thought of and is invigorating especially Cold Plunge pool.

Service: we were greeted at the front desk by a pleasant attendant and shown facilities. You must pay upfront before proceeding to the change room.Upon finishing staff at the reception desk have changed and the lady looked a bit bored and unfriendly.
Facilities: Clean, nice robes, great powder room stocked with all necessities.
Location: easy to get to via 504 King East streetcar.

Suggestion: why not have a station with herbal teas included in price? It is a spa and I have seen it at many. Yes have your juices/smoothies also available for purchase but tea doesn't cost a fortune to prepare.
Didn't appreciate swimsuit optional. It is a public space and some might not like it. Too liberal.
Overall: would go again :)

reviews.title: Relaxing way to spend a couple of hours
text: This is a woman's only facility but  probably not for the very modest as swim suits are optional (I found it very liberating!). You can walk in off the street and you will be provided with everything needed. The basic water therapy circuit includes 3 pools, a sauna and a steam room and is quite affordable. Other therapies, massage, wraps, scrubs, etc are also available. I found the place to be extremely clean (the waters were being tested when I was there), the staff pleasantly helpful.  I left feeling thoroughly relaxed and my skin ultra clean and de-toxed. I will definitely be back.

reviews.title: won't be back!
text: I attended the King East location with friends.  We all experienced irritated eyes.  It was especially bad in the sauna and steam room.  I had to leave after a few seconds and rinse my eyes.  I have been to many spas and never had this happen before.  There is a lot of staffing walking around cleaning but there was clearly something wrong with their water.

The reception area is nice, but the rest of the spa feels very cheap.  In my view it barely qualifies as a spa.  The pool area feels like being in an outdated fitness centre/community pool.  You only get one small towel that gets soaked almost immediately and one large towel for when you are done - nowhere to get a new one.  Not what I expect when paying $70 for water therapy.

There is no decent privacy so if you are body conscious this is definitely not the place for you!  The locker room has no change rooms.  The bath stalls are small and have no toilet lid so there is only a tiny shelf and one hook to put your clothes on.  Getting changed in there is not easy.  There is only one shower area with frosted glass that is used by those rinsing between pools and after you are done.  There is a small stool outside that is always wet so you have to hang your stuff on the hook across from the stalls.  This means that you will be fully exposed as you grab your towel.
Also be aware that bathing suits are optional.  It is women's only and everyone was clothed during my visit.
There are many great spas in Toronto.  This is not one of them.  There are many better options available

reviews.title: Great downtown spa
text: I had a very pleasant experience at the BB West location. It was clean, friendly attentive staff and great over all facilities. I started off my visit with a massage and I was content with that service as well.

reviews.title: Perfect day!
text: This is our second time coming to this spa, and my friend and I will definitely return! It’s so relaxing and fun and super clean! My massage was outstanding and she even gave me tips and exercises to help relieve some tightness and pain in my hips and legs - so grateful..(thanks Ali!) Wish we lived closer, I would go everyday!

reviews.title: Relaxation at its finest!!
text: Went to Body Blitz Spa today in the east end at king street and had the most relaxing time! The girls at the front were so sweet and welcoming. After a long time finding parking the girls were able to help me out and help me find a spot that would make sure my car wouldn’t be towed.
I highly recommend going during the week where it’s not as busy as it would be on the weekends.
I loved the therapeutic pools with the eucalyptus steam room and the sauna, it made for a really relaxing and enjoyable circuit. There is always staff around to help out and clean up.

I also got a chai shake from the juice bar to enjoy in the Dead Sea pool and it was soooo delicious! Although it is on the pricier side, I definitely needed a pampering day so it was well worth it! I also got a 60min massage where I was invited to use the pools after as well!
— the only downside is the limited parking that can make it difficult but that’s nothing on body blitz just something to research before.

reviews.title: Average
text: I went to this place by friend's recommendation. Its interior design is modern and simplistic with bright light. Bath area is quite big and could fit many women. I found it noisy to my taste (as I usually come to chill and relax in spas). Women are very talkative and stone, glass, concrete and metal are not very good sound isolating materials. There are quite little rooms: hot steam room with eucalyptus infusion and infrared sauna (very small and just warm, not hot as it supposedly makes you sweat by infrared waves). There is a juice bar service, not included in your visit price. So if you drink water or feel hungry during your stay you might want to bring your own snacks and water. There is drinking water fountains however.

reviews.title: Awesome Experience.
text: I had never been, and a friend invited me to give it a try.  Now I had been to Scandinavian spa at Blue Mountain, so I knew what to expect with the pool aspect of the spa.   Wonderful and very clean.  I also had 2 treatments. A 1 hour body massage by Ali (wonderful woman!) and a 1 hour morrocan Spice Body scrub treatment. (which also included a massage!)  very professional, as it is a full body scrub, not once was I cold nor uncomfortable. I can't wait to go back.   Highly recommended!
Leave your modesty at the door as clothing is optional here.

reviews.title: Transphobic
text: The staff here do not allow transgender women at their spas. Not only that but the staff at Body Blitz Spa are very rude and unprofessional.

reviews.title: You deserve this! Super relaxing spa break. Women only.
text: I love Body Blitz. It's even worth the 2 hour drive home after, sitting in traffic. Why? Because all stress melts away when you visit this spa.
This is a women's only spa.
Nudity is allowed.
Cameras/phones are not.

No phones adds to the serenity and deep relaxation that comes with truly going offline for a few hours. Not having anyone around you on a phone takes away any anxiety about what important message you might be missing. Just relax here. This is truly you time.
Book in advance so you are not turned away.
Street parking only. Do TTC if you can. I live out of city so I can't.
When you arrive you check in with reception.  They provide you with a locker key. You can also order a drink to be delivered to you spa side, at your desired time.
In the locker room, an attendant will provide you with slippers. Your locker will have your towels and robe waiting for you.
You also have an assigned cubby spa side, so if you want to take a chapstick, water bottle or other item along, you can.
Showers are required before entering the spa. Enjoy the scents of the spa shampoo and conditioner provided.
Spa side you will enjoy a warm pool, sauna, steam room, cold tub and hot tub, as well as lounge chairs for resting ( read, melting into).

The wall posted times give you recommendations on the spa circuit and how long to stay in each section.  I usually do about 2 circuits with some rest. This makes for a 2-3 hour visit. I am completely relaxed after. There is an option for massage too. I have not booked it.
The water fountains keep you hydrated. Drink up!
Go! Relax! Enjoy. :)

reviews.title: Overpriced not warm or inviting
text: I visited the King location on a Friday early afternoon for a visit at the pools and a body scrub service.  I was expecting a relaxing afternoon in a spa like setting and unfortunately this was not the case.   While the pools are clean it is an uninviting atmosphere as everything is concrete and it reminds me of a community pool, definitely not a relaxing spa like environment.  The steam and sauna rooms were not hot enough compared to other spas I have visited.

I had a body scrub service and while the estitician was pleasant and did her job for me the experience was average compared to other spas and for the amount paid for the service and the pools is not worth the cost ($200). The rooms for the body services are like the pool areas the floors are concrete and not spa like.  The doors to the rooms are not full length so they are open on top and the bottom so you can hear things from the other rooms and the hallway.  As well I feel the rooms should be warmer and perhaps warmed towels provided between treatments.  At some points between the treatments it felt like there was a draft.

I should mention some women attend the pools topless which is fine but might not be recommended if you want to bring your teen daughter.  I am happy though that they recently changed their policy to require woman to wear bottoms as previously this wasn't required.
I received a gift certificate to Body Blitz and based on my experience and the price I would much rather visit one of the other spas in Toronto or Scandinave spa.

reviews.title: Overpriced not Spa Like
text: I am disappointed with my experience at Body Blitz. (King East location).  I bought access to the therapeutic waters only on early Friday afternoon.  For the price I was expecting high end relaxing atmosphere. The pools are all located in one area with an industrial like feel. With other guests talking loudly and the humming of the background equipment it felt like a community pool and not a relaxing spa. There is not quiet sitting rest areas to relax and destress. The steam room and sauna were not hot enough. Even after rinsing between pools as recommended and shower I still smelt like chlorine the next day and had a headache after leaving the spa.
I did enjoy the option of the smoothie service and overall the pools were clean.
If your looking for a condo like hang out this is the spot for you. For this price I would recommend accessing the Scandinave spa.

reviews.title: Terrible
text: I called the King Street location (East) to book for two massage appointments for myself and my sister. I specifically stated that I was treating my sister for her birthday. I also specifically asked for registered massage therapists and requested receipts for insurance purposes. I was told that all of the therapists are RMTs. Great! (I thought).

Upon arrival, we were asked to pay up-front, which was fine. I gave cash for my sister’s massage. I was then told that she would not be able to get a receipt for insurance purposes since I was paying. I was surprised, as I wasn’t made aware of this policy upon booking. No problem, the policy actually made sense to me since I am a pharmacist and I know how fussy insurance companies can be. So I took my cash back and my sister paid for her own massage with her own cash.

We were then escorted into the spa for our water experience and massages. It was not until AFTER our massages that my sister was abruptly told that she WOULD NOT be receiving a receipt for insurance purposes since I had paid for her massage.  What?!?!?!  This was a complete surprise. We were so disappointed, upset, and caught off guard. The staff were insinuating that we were lying, and the cash was mine (and not my sisters’). They said that if she wanted a receipt she would have to pay by credit card. What?!?!? I have NEVER been treated so poorly in my life. It was like we were on trial for paying with cash!!!! It was actually ridiculous.
1) I should have been told about this policy when I booked. Especially since I specifically mentioned treating for her birthday and asked for receipts.
2) if they didn’t want to give us a receipt they should have told us BEFORE going in, not after the fact.
Ultimately, the manager issued the receipt since she realized the ridiculousness of the whole situation. I left with a throbbing headache and popped 2 Advil tablets on the way out.
Will not return here. I do not recommend this place.

reviews.title: Body Blitz is great (ish)- unless you have an issue.
text: Body blitz has been my treat in the city whenever I really needed to escape, and I usually visit about 2 times a year. My most recent visit to the spa was terrible, for the following reasons (At the King Street location):

Excessive levels of chlorine: midway through my spa visit, I started sneezing incessantly, my skin started to break into a rash, and my eyes started burning to the point that I could not read the reading material I had brought. As mentioned, I’ve been here many times and have never experienced this issue, leading me to believe that for some reason the levels were excessive on this particular day. These issues resulted in me staying for about half the time I normally do (at close to $70 dollars for entry, this is a real bummer) and went home feeling extremely sick. The effects (headache, runny nose, and other “cold-like” symptoms) lingered for 24 hours afterwards.  Researching online, I found that these symptoms matched those of over-exposure to chlorine, and that they should pass in 24 hours after exposure. They lasted almost exactly 24 hours and I spent the entire time in bed.

Excessive noise: There was a long wait time on the day I visited, indicating that it was a busy day overall, but the levels of noise in the facility were excessive. It is a social spa, but it's also located in a warehouse, and with loud conversations being had by most groups, you could barely hear yourself think. It was the opposite of relaxing and I had to use ear plugs when in the main area. There are signs around the facility suggesting that conversations should be in hushed tone, I mean this isn’t a seaside pool in a vacation destination during spring break. But there was no attempt made by any of the staff to manage the levels of noise.

Dirty facility: the facility itself feels old and like it’s falling apart a bit. My locker was broken, which I only realized when I went back to double check. In addition I was looking to buy one of their facial scrubs (which have a very high price point at over $45 dollars) or other beauty products and when I looked on the back, they were expired! This is not the marker of a high quality spa using high quality products.

In light of all of these issues and my normally positive visits, I assumed that the spa would want to properly address my concerns and would provide me with some kind of compensation for the experience, or some incentive to come again once the issues were resolved. I mean the spa made me sick! This was not the case. The customer service at Body Blitz is apparently non-existent if you have a concern. Not that the girls pay much attention to you when everything is a-ok, but they have absolutely no process for dealing with customer concerns. Buyer beware I guess. This is a very successful spa judging by the number of clients and their ability to open additional locations. But they were not willing to address a situation which they acknowledged was “outside of the norm”.

I would suggest saving your money for a trip to Spa Scandinave (awesome experience and customer service all around) instead of visiting this overpriced spa, with limited concern for their guests enjoyment or health, as evidenced by their response to my recent issues. The fact that they can continue to flourish as a business while not taking a genuine customer service issue to heart and indicating some responsibility and attempt to rectify the issue is really unfortunate in a city with so many options.

reviews.title: Best Relax Spot
text: My friend and I go often and love Body Blitz. Very calm, quiet and relaxing day spent in the therapeutic water circuit.

reviews.title: Relaxing but pricey water circuit
text: The spa was very clean and efficient. Patrons are given robes, shoes, and lockers on check in.  There are instructions and posters for the water circuit making it easy to follow.  There were lots of chairs and spaces available on the weeknight I visited.  It was nice having everything indoors for the Winter, but still prefer the outdoor Scandinave spa settings.  The spa was on the pricey side if you spend only an hour there.

reviews.title: Prices have nearly doubled - not worth it anymore.
text: I used to love visiting body blitz spa for a day downtown with my sister or girlfriends, however I was just about to purchase a gift card online and was shocked and very disappointed to learn that they have increased their prices - by almost double. For the exact same service. Needless to say, I won't be returning, which is unfortunate, as i did enjoy it very much. Very sad.

reviews.title: Best birthday gift ever...
text: A day at the spa! My smart daughter’s birthday gift! Wonderful idea!
We did the water circuit first...saltwater pool/ sauna/steam room/cold plunge/epsom salt hot tub...a chart is available for suggested route.
Then a relaxing massage...Momo was amazing...the right amount of pressure, focusing on my problem areas...exhilarating!
Great staff...at front desk and on premises...
Well-equipped & organized: lockers, clean showers, towels, robes, toiletries, etc...
Delicious energy drinks (extra charge)...
Seniors get 10% off...
Highly recommendable...you owe it to yourself!
Do not wear a good swimsuit...the salts might bleach it!

reviews.title: Shadow of Former Self
text: I have lived in the King West neighbourhood for over the past 10 years and have always considered this place one of King West’s hidden gems. I used to love coming here to treat myself. Before my trip this week, the last time I was here was about a year ago and boy has it changed.

From check-in to treatment to the time I left I found almost all the staff to be abrupt or borderline unfriendly. I took off my slippers about 3 feet from the pool so that I could get into the pool and within seconds I was being reprimanded for not wearing my slippers on the pool deck. When I told the attendant, “but I’m getting into the pool” she just said ok with a bit of a tone and walked away.

To be fair, when I was checking in, one of the front desk girls seemed to be fielding what seemed like a rather abusive phone call. I know they’ve had some bad PR over the past couple years and maybe they have had to put up with a lot of BS from the public lately. Perhaps this is what is causing them to be more aggressive than in the past? I’m trying to give them the benefit of the doubt, but it doesn’t change the fact that’s it’s hard to enjoy what should be a peaceful spa experience when most of the staff act like they don’t want to be there. I say most because there was one shining star. Maricar was extremely pleasant and helpful to me while I was there. Almost made up for the rest.
The spa was very busy and noisy compared to how it used to be. I assumed it was due to the holidays but from seeing some other recent reviews I guess this is the new normal.

When I called to book the appointment, was a little unnerved to hear they had my credit card “saved on file”. No reason for this as I haven’t used them in about a year. As someone in cyber security, this raised some red flags for me.
I may or may not come back for the waters but will be getting my massages at Hammam in the future. It’s a shame what they have become. This place used to be really special.

reviews.title: Restorative Relaxation
text: To celebrate our birthdays (hers in late September and mine in early November) a friend recommended we visit Body Blitz Spa. I’d never been, so was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere and facilities, and the rates are very reasonable.
Catering to women only, it’s a great place to unwind, and soothe body and soul by taking in the spectrum of water-related activities.

I especially loved the salt water pool and eucalyptus steam room! Everything is very clean and well-maintained. There was even someone squeegeeing the floors in the main service area to help avoid slipping.
Now that I’ve found this, I will be back to sample the spa services!

reviews.title: Very nice time atthe spa
text: Loved this place! I went on a Wednesday morning right at ten. The place was clean and comfortable and I enjoyed it very much. Yes allow yourself at least two hours to fully enjoy the water circuit. My skin felt smooth and wonderful after the session. I would recommend morning during the week so it does not get too crowded.
The only suggestion is to allow towels in the steam room and have bathing suit dryers in the change room so it dries out your suit somewhat.

reviews.title: Very calming - but stay away from the scrubs
text: I really enjoy coming here. The staff are all very friendly and professional, the atmosphere is tranquil and the circuit is very calming. I always have a chance to clear my head when I visit body blitz. My last visit I decided to have a massage (which was one of the best I have ever had) and a body scrub. I was quite disappointed with the scrub, it felt sterile and similar to what I imagine one would feel when getting prepped for surgery. My scrub was supposed to be 25 minutes, it was much less. I left feeling like I spent $80.00 on a treatment that I would have preferred never to have had. I really urge the company to rethink how they do the scrub service, and possibly rethink the price point as well. If a massage is essentially just over $100 for an hour, by a RMT then the scrub which lasts less then 20 minutes should be much less. Just my thoughts.

reviews.title: Awesome time!
text: Body blitz is a wonderful facility! Nice atmosphere, and great amenities such as the water therapies. I enjoyed my time there.

reviews.title: Worst experience ever
text: A spa day should be relaxing ....no if you go to body blitz Adelaide.

Front desk staff is rude, got 30 min earlier with my 80 years old mother  and was not allowed to get in, left in the reception which does not have very comfortable furnitures to wait especially for a 80 years old.  Asked for a cancellation and they said that will cost me 50% of the treatment  ....,, all in a very dissapointed experience.,,.,never again!

reviews.title: Good but disappointed with some aspects
text: I am from Calgary and was in Toronto from March 27-29 on business. I love spa experiences so I looked up best spas online and found body blitz to be rated at the top for women. I was very impressed with the actual set up of the healing waters and all the facilities were clean and comfortable. I wasn't bothered by the chatting while in the main pool area however in the sauna and steam room where it very clearly states no talking allowed, people still chatted loudly resulting in other people leaving. I thought this was inconsiderate and should be addressed. I also had a 60min massage. The treatment room and area is very basic. The massage itself was good however I had asked for my scalp to be focused on and this was overlooked. Before I could mention it again the massage was over! For the amount of money spent, I expect heated massage bed, warm towels, eye covers, and a small pillow for various parts of the massage. This is what is offered in my favourite spa in Calgary for about the same cost. I'm honestly being picky however for the money I expected more.

reviews.title: AMAZING, Loved it!!
text: We went as a girls weekend, with 4 generations of ladies. We enjoyed the waters, then each picked a different body pkg. Wilma did my body bake. It was my first time. She was amazing. I was very comfortable. I felt amazing after. Loved that the staff took pictures for me, outside the spa. Make sure you treat yourself to the different drinks. We had a smoothie It was amazing, very tasty, filling, and totally helped with the spa experience. WOW..really worth the drive! Enjoy!!

reviews.title: Nice Visit
text: I visited June 2018. My husband had bought a package for me, so I enjoyed it for my birthday. I went in for a few hours and enjoyed the waters, a massage and a body scrub. The RMT was great. The other service provider did well, but worked very quickly.
It was my first time there. I wish I had received a lengthier tour and/or better service from staff - ie: I didn't know which pool was what. Staff focused on getting me in and out fast.
My husband drove me and picked me up. I can't image having to find parking in the area (probably not the easiest).
I didn't see guests on their phones which was great (unlike a few other spas in the city).
Overall a good experience. I may return, but will have more questions ready for the staff!

reviews.title: Lovely birthday treat!
text: My thoughtful daughters surprised me with a spa day recently at Body Blitz. I'd never been here but one of my kids has been a number of times and really enjoys it. She has gone alone and with friends. I overpacked, not sure what to bring and was pleasantly surprised to find that they had everything ready and waiting. They even provided locks for the lockers (which I brought!), and inside, was a stack of neatly folded towels and your spa robe for your visit. They also supply you with rubber slippers (and yes, I brought my own flip flops), plus there is a vanity room for the end of your visit where you can take care of hair and makeup if you choose to, fully stocked with all of the necessities (no curling or flat irons so you're on your own there!).
We did the water circuit first...saltwater pool/ sauna/steam room/cold plunge/epsom salt hot tub...a chart is available for suggested route but I was in the company of an expert!

Then they treated me to a relaxing massage. The RMT asked detailed questions to make sure they used the right amount of pressure, focusing on my problem areas. The room was quiet and dim, just as you'd expect. Everything was perfect!
Following that we ordered smoothies to have poolside, and there were lovely cozy lounge chairs to relax in (because all of this spa business can be exhausting!)
Great staff at front desk and on premises. Everyone was helpful in getting extra towels when needed or cups for the purified water. I felt pampered inside and out!
We've decided to come for each of their birthdays again. What a great new tradition!
